title: epi2me-labs/wf-single-cell
description: Identification of cell barcodend UMI sequences present in nanopore sequencing reads.

basic_input_output_options.title: Basic Input/Output Options
basic_input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

fastq.description: A fastq file or directory containing fastq input files or directories of input files.
fastq.help_text: If directories named \"barcode*\" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently. If `.fastq(.gz)` files are found under the `--fastq` directory the sample is assumed to not be multiplexed. In this second case `--samples` should be a simple name rather than a CSV file.

sample.description: A sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a file or directory of .fastq(.gz).

sample_sheet.description: CSV file with columns named `barcode`, `sample_name` and `type`. Permissible if passing a directory containing barcodeXX sub-directories. Barcodes here referes to nanopore sample barcodes

single_cell_sample_sheet.description: The single-cell-sample sheet asoociates the samples with 10x kits that were used to process them. This is sperate to the basecaller sample sheet. the run_id should correspond to sample_name which is defined either in the `sample_sheet`, given by the `sample`parameter (for single sample runs) or if no `sample_sheet` or `sample` is given, is derived from the folder name containing the fastq files.

ref_genome_dir.description: The path to the reference directory as downloaded from 10x

sanitize_fastq.description: Use additional heuristics to identify barcodes from file paths.
sanitize_fastq.help_text: Enabling this option will group together files into samples by the presence of strings of the form `barcodeXXX` present in filenames, rather than simply files grouped into directories (as output by MinKNOW and the Guppy basecaller).

advanced_options.title: Advanced options
advanced_options.description: Define more advanced options for tweaking the workflow.

max_threads.description: Maximum number of threads to use

barcode_max_ed.description: maximum edit distance for barcode identification?

barcode_min_ed_diff.description: minimum edit distance for barcode identification?

umi_cluster_max_threads.description: Maximum number of threads to use in UMI clustering step

umap_plot_genes.description: List of gene symbols to perform UMI clustering on.

resources_mm2_mem_gb.description: Maximum allowed memory in GB for the minimp2 stage.

resources_mm2_max_threads.description: Maximum allowed threads for the minimp2 stage.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

The following single-cell kits from 10x Genomics are currently supported:
- Chromium Single Cell [3ʹ gene expression](https://teichlab.github.io/scg_lib_structs/methods_html/10xChromium3.html), versions 2 and 3
- Chromium Single Cell [5ʹ gene expression](https://teichlab.github.io/scg_lib_structs/methods_html/10xChromium5.html), version 1
- Chromium Single Cell [Multiome (ATAC + GEX)](https://teichlab.github.io/scg_lib_structs/methods_html/10xChromium_multiome.html), version 1

Oxford Nanopore has developed a protocol for sequencing single-cell libraries from 10x, which can be found on the Nanopore Community [website](https://community.nanoporetech.com/docs/prepare/library_prep_protocols/single-cell-transcriptomics-10x/v/sst_v9148_v111_revb_12jan2022).

The inputs to Sockeye are raw nanopore reads (FASTQ) generated from the sequencing
instrument and reference files that can be downloaded from [10x](https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/software/downloads/latest).
The pipeline outputs a gene x cell expression matrix, as well as a BAM file of
aligned reads tagged with cell barcode and UMI information.

Package dependencies
--------------------

The wf-single-cell pipeline makes use of the following dependencies.

- bedtools
- bioframe
- biopython
- editdistance
- matplotlib
- minimap2
- numpy
- pandas
- parasail-python
- pysam
- samtools
- scikit-learn
- seqkit
- tqdm
- umap-learn
- vsearch

Additionally, while no explicit dependency exists for the
[UMI-tools](https://github.com/CGATOxford/UMI-tools) package, the script
``bin/cluster_umis.py`` makes significant use of several functions from
the package. More detailed acknowledgements can be found in the source code.
